title: Doubly Linked List
description: A doubly linked list is a linked list in which each node contains a reference to both the next and previous node.
keyPoints: Each node has next and prev pointers.
More memory usage than singly linked list.

techniques.title: Insert at Head
techniques.codeSnippet: const newNode = new Node(val); newNode.next = head; if (head) head.prev = newNode; head = newNode;
techniques.description: Insert a new node at the beginning of a doubly linked list.

techniques.title: Delete a Node
techniques.codeSnippet: if (node.prev) node.prev.next = node.next; if (node.next) node.next.prev = node.prev;
techniques.description: Remove a node from a doubly linked list.

codeSnippet.code: class Node { constructor(val) { this.val = val; this.next = null; this.prev = null; } }
